job_title: Math Lab Coordinator/Tutor in Temple, TX
pros: Community Small town feel Excellent coworkers
cons: Limited candidates for hourly employees in the area

pros: There is no pro for working there
cons: Lack of support, gaslighting by management. Wages are not on trend for the industry you could get paid more in fast food. Tons of micro-managing. Hostile work environment. Micro aggression racism. Outdated technology and business practice. No inclusivity.

review_title: Good place to work, but low pay
pros: Good environment, and caring people!
cons: Lower than average pay for Texas I feel

pros: Temple College has a lovely campus with blooming Crepe Myrtle trees and appealing landscaping. Most of the students are eager to learn and easy to work with. I highly recommend their Music Department for degree plans, or employment.
cons: Support staff are provided inadequate pay and no opportunity for advancement. I work in the Writing Center, where I have worked part-time for five years. The TC administration will not make the positions full-time, in spite of our Director and other Staff earnestly requesting this multiple times. When everyone quit over the Spring of 2021, I was asked to take full-time hours temporarily (without PTO, vacation or benefits). I was told that I could only work full-time hours for a few weeks at a time, and would have to go back to part-time, and then back to full hours (at their convenience). They wanted me to make my hours a "yo-yo" going back and forth from full to part-time hours over 2021-2022 (but no benefits!)! Pay is inadequate, and paychecks are squeezed by too few days on the job during the holidays. In fact, the position made $15. an hour six years ago and the Board have now dropped the scale to $14. an hour. It is a revolving door of support staff, in the Writing Center, the Math Lab and other areas. Temple College Administration does not invest in their support staff by providing adequate full-time hours and benefits.

pros: The students. They really want to learn.
cons: Poor management, no benefits, in the middle of the pandemic I was working way over 40 hours a week, even though I was a part-time teacher. They didn't want anyone to become a full-time teacher. No opportunities to grow.

pros:

pros: Very flexible within each department of Student and Enrollment Services. Promotes teamwork and coordinating between each entity department, i.e., Financial AId, Advising, Admissions. Several paid days off during the year. Good medical & dental options and a great retirement system with the TX Teacher's Retirement.
cons: The days can drag sometimes, and the number of students can be pretty random throughout the day.

pros: Some of the best people I have ever worked with. I worked in the Veteran Office, but there are positions in each office. They treat you amazing and work around your schedule every semester. I couldn't recommend a better job
cons: None that I can think of

job_title: Anatomy Lab Monitor in Temple, TX
pros: Temple College is a good community college to get your associates before moving on to your university for your bachelors. I loved my time there as a student and when I worked there from 2001-2005.
cons: Far to many administration changes from 2003-2017 (I can’t speak for the present), department heads either over worked or just checked out to the point of not checking emails from their employees that were not faculty. Students treating study labs and libraries like social halls or other community areas where they can hang out and chat rather than study quietly. Homeless people trying to break in to the buildings on the weekend (thank god for campus security being out doing his rounds!) horrible horrible horrible benefits.

review_title: Love my job, but I don't love the pay.
pros: Temple College is a very friendly place to work. The students are great and so are the other teachers. I have always felt welcome and included-which is something that is common with adjuncts at other institutions.
cons: The pay. Adjunct pay is just unreasonable. Limited budgets aside, there has got to be a better way to compensate instructors.

review_title: Rated one of the best Community Colleges in Texas!
pros: Great benefits and very accommodating with work and family time. Able to get six hours of free classes a semester. Plenty of built in vacation time, with two weeks off for Christmas, Fridays off during the summer, and more.
cons: They pay is not great, but it is on par for Central Texas.

pros: As a student worker, you gain skill sets in organization and multitasking that impact your success in your education. All of the employees are positive and encouraging.
cons: The school is small, so perhaps a little limiting in the experiences gained through interacting with all types of individuals.

review_title: Not great pay, but easy work.
job_title: Writing Center Consultant in Temple, TX
pros: Very easy-going, appointment schedule keeps tutors from being overwhelmed by a dozen students walking in at once, usually pretty quiet.
cons: The college won't hire any full-time tutors, so most of us have multiple jobs. Pay isn't great for the degree required.

review_title: Not a friendly environment head staff needs better communication skills with employers.
pros: If you like serving the public it's a good fast pace company.
cons: If you aren't a quick study don't apply they are not friendly to those who are not.

review_title: Good boss, but full-time positions unavailable
pros: Writing center director is a good boss, work is low impact, appointment-only scheduling reduces amount of walk-in traffic
cons: full-time work is unavailable, pay is low for the education required

pros: You have alot of holidays off. 2 weeks at christmas break and 1 week for spring break.
cons: Pay is not good at all.

pros: They left me alone to teach the classes the way I wanted.
